Fields.DialogueText: Agh! Get it off, get it off-
Captain?! What in heaven's name is going on?
I sat down- and now something's trying to claw my back apart-
You poor little thing! Did the mean Captain sit on you? Did they squish your poor little tail?

Fields.MenuText: The mean *Captain?*
Is that a cat?
Your voice just went up an octave.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not. It's just surprising... I didn't think you were the type.
You sat down on her. She's tiny compared to you.
You haven't been formally introduced, have you?
The type? Captain, I don't know if you should be telling me about your 'type'...
Captain, this is Stripey. Our ship's cat. Stripey--
That's not what I - ugh, never mind.
I'm trying to decide what to ask Cook to order.

Fields.MenuText: Salmon.
Chicken.
...Is this for you, or for the cat?

Fields.DialogueText: Wonderful. Let me just note that down...
I'll have to debone it, of course. We can't have her choking... Little bones aren't good for cats.
You really love Stripey, don't you?
Of course. She's a valuable member of the crew.
I wasn't going to say anything.
Nothing too concerning, Captain. I was lost in thought again.

Fields.MenuText: If you ever need to share those thoughts, I'm here.
That's concerning in its own right.
Did you learn nothing from last time?

Fields.DialogueText: I learnt that you think I need to be in a mental hospital.
It's a kind offer, Captain, but in this case, I'm better off thinking alone.
I know you don't want me to  spend too much time thinking about... things. But in this case, it's necessary.
Captain, I'm glad for your concern, but...
If we do not want to repeat our mistakes, we must first consider what happened. Dispassionately. Logically.
Staring into the middle distance isn't logical...
It's a hazard of taking that time.
... Didn't you tell me they weren't *your* mistakes?
... I'll explain later, Captain.  Shall we?
Here she comes! Batten down the hatches!
What? I can't make it out.
You might not want to. In fact, you might want to go below decks.
I brought you the justice you seek. And you'll have more, if you come with me!

Fields.MenuText: The admiral who left you to hang--

Fields.DialogueText: ... That's a decent approximation of Admiral Jellicoe's corpse. Hanging off her bow.

Fields.MenuText: There's no way this can be real.
I don't know what she's playing at, but she's a Morgana. Don't listen.

Fields.DialogueText: Humanity won't give you the justice you want. They'll tell you that it's over. All in the past.
What can you give me that they can't?!
In my cabin. Don't come in.
After that last battle, I just wanted to -- I don't know. Make sure you were still on an even keel.
You're a good Captain. But really. I'm fine.

Fields.MenuText: Then you're made of much stronger stuff than I am.
Glad to hear it. You're... important to me, Spite.
If you're sure.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, she doesn't know what 'fear' means yet.
And you mean to teach her?
You do spend a lot of time there.
You're important to me, too. If anything changes, you'll be the first to know.
A steel hull is much stronger than human flesh.
Are you sure you don't want me-
Why not? Here, I can just crack the door-
I told you. You really don't like that cat.
It's more that she doesn't like me.
She's very protective. But I'm sure you'll warm up to each other in time.
Let's hope so. For both our sakes.
The other day. You were talking about *your* mistakes.
When we talked before, you really seemed like... You understood. That it wasn't your fault.
... I understood, at the time we spoke. But in the moment, when she...
Did you really need to clarify, Captain? Yes, the Morgana.
It was before she showed up.

Fields.MenuText: I'm worried you're slipping.
Just... feel free to tell me if you need anything, all right?
We need to keep you shipshape.

Fields.DialogueText: If I feel the slightest sense of decline, I will let you know.
... I believe you. It's just hard to believe that none of that affected you.
I will finish this conversation later.
Dear old girl. I don't know where I'd be without you.
Whenever you're around, I feel so much safer.
What's the opposite of a Morgana? Is it you? Is it you?
Ah. Captain? How's your day been?
How'd you know I was behind you?
I have a very effective alarm system.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not going to hurt you, or your Belle.
Whoa, there. Steady, girl.
That cat hates me.

Fields.DialogueText: She's like me, Captain. You have to earn her trust.
And how am I supposed to do that?
Looks like we just got a delivery.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were jealous.
Jealous? No! I just want her to like me. See?
Are you lost in thought again?
There's a two-part problem that's causing me to get lost in thought. We must deal with both parts.
First: Injustice. She's causing us both grief. When she shows up, I...

Fields.MenuText: ... Is what she says convincing?
You were angrier than I've ever seen you.
If she doesn't look out, she'll lose hers.

Fields.DialogueText: And I'll be the one to take it.
If it was coming from another Belle? I'd say she had a point. But it's war propaganda.
She's trying to get in my head. I won't let her.
I'm right there with you. Injustice is a problem. But now we know she's patrolling here- and you've sunk her a couple times- we know how to handle her.
Right. But she's not the only problem.
What else could be as bad as-
I'll explain later, Captain. For now, let's just say...
Yes, Captain. As long as you hate Stripey, we've got a personnel problem that needs to be resolved.
You can't stand to be in the same room. To the point where I'm getting lost in thought over it.
If you don't hate her, what's the problem?
Is it allergies? A phobia? Past trauma? Psychosomatic allergies caused by a phobia?
I agree, but I don't think the problem is what you think it is.

Fields.MenuText: I like cats.
I don't like cats much, but-
Whether or not I like cats is irrelevant.

Fields.DialogueText: It's relevant if you treat my dear friend horribly because of it.
The problem is that Stripey hates *me*.
Well, there you go. If she's hissing and spitting at me every time I enter a room, I'm scared she'll claw my face off.
She won't. They will. To arms, Captain?
To arms. But this isn't over.
So? Have you considered your strategy?
We're safe for now. Let's talk about the personnel problem.
By which you mean your cat.
Yes, Captain. I need her with me as often as possible.
If the two of you can't be in the same room, we have a problem.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should talk to Stripey about this.
Believe me, I want to fix this as much as you do.
We can be in the same room. You just have to hold her back so she won't claw my face off.

Fields.DialogueText: It amounts to the same thing.
You've both proven to be rather uncommunicative, Captain.
If we had fewer Morgana battles, I'd have more time to think.
Mm? Can I help you, Captain?
Did you ever figure out whether Stripey prefers chicken or salmon?
Oh! As it turns out, she likes both. But...
Her absolute favourite is beef. Why do you ask?
Mm. I'm trying to figure out the "personnel problem."
You plan to bribe her? A solid strategy.

Fields.MenuText: She's a cat.
Hey, if it works, it works.
I just want to be able to spend time with you again.

Fields.DialogueText: And if it means befriending Stripey...
If you're asking what I think you're asking, then yes. I would choose beef.
I hope she hates the Morganas more than she hates me!
Of course she does. Don't you?
You said you want... cookie cutters?
Mmhm. Preferably ones in shapes cats like.
Well, it's been hard to find anything made of tin lately...
Right. It's all going to the war effort.
Or Morgana raids. But I'll see what I can do.
Thanks. I know it's an odd thing to ask...
It's not the strangest requisition I've had to field.
Before I came here, I was stationed on Provence. You know how many tubes of paint she went through?
Try triple. I swear, sometimes it feels like being a stage manager.
All the world's a stage, and all that...
Mmhm. I'll get you your cookie cutters. --You *really* want to impress our Belle, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Not like *that*, I don't.
She's become a good friend.
Less trying to impress her and more trying to make up to her.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't kiss and tell. I respect that.
I just wish her cat liked me.
Her cat and I don't see eye to eye.
Mmm. Stripey will come around to you. She likes people who feed her.
Don't mention it. Break a leg, Captain!
Hey. Don't you hiss at me.
Captain! I see you're trying to negotiate.
We're at a bit of an impasse.
Pity. Will you start "aggressive negotiations," then?
I'd never hurt your cat. And anyway, I still don't have my secret weapon.

Fields.MenuText: You'll see when the time comes.
I thought you would have guessed by now.
Trying to guess? You need a hint?

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't been able to finish it because we haven't been able to source the aluminum.
I have an inkling, but give me a hint.
I suppose I will. You're being awfully coy...
Let's give her what for, Captain.
There's something I wanted to ask you, Captain.
I wanted to ask you... if you've seen what I've seen.

Fields.MenuText: Are you, uh, seeing things?
Let's hear it.
Is this about Stripey, or something I need to worry about?

Fields.DialogueText: It's about Stripey. But I think you need to worry about it.
I think I know why Stripey's been so upset with you. *And* I think I know what to do about it.
You buried the lede there, huh?
Not intentionally. But have you noticed-
When she gets agitated... it's rarely *just* because you're in the room.
Think about it. What's happened every time you two have had a spat?
For the love of- I'm not *arguing* with your *cat*!
I'm telling you, Captain, there's a pattern.
You can tell me about it after the battle.
So. What's this about a pattern?
Of course. This is clearly important to you.
Clearly. But you cut me off.

Fields.MenuText: We were about to engage. I didn't want to get distracted.
We're no longer in a war zone. We have time to talk about peaceful things now.
And I'm sorry for doing that. We had bigger fish to fry.

Fields.DialogueText: We do. But this isn't just a domestic conversation anymore, Captain.
We did. And so does Stripey.
Mmm. It's less of a distraction than you might think.
I- I see. So what's going on?
Every time you and Stripey have had an... aggressive negotiation...
One of two things has happened.
Either we've had a Morgana attack, or you and I have immediately started fighting.
You could set your watch by both those things these days.
Mmm. But don't you see the connection?
Good grief. I think I see what you mean.
I'll spell it out once we're done here.
Good. Let's clean up as fast as we can.
Domestic? You make it sound like we're an old married couple.
Maybe we will be someday. But we have to settle this first.
So, let me get this straight.
You've been more agitated than usual lately because Injustice is up to her usual malarkey...
Right. And so things that wouldn't normally bother you have been getting to you.
Mmm. It *would* normally upset me if I thought you disliked my cat, but not to the point where I'd argue with you in public.
You've been irritable lately, it's true.
And you think Stripey is... picking up on all this, somehow.
Stripey can sense when I'm about to have an... episode.
I think she might be able to tell when... I'm more agitated than normal, as well.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think you're going to have another 'episode' because of all this?
Some animals are very clever, it's true.
I've heard that some old soldiers have guide dogs, but a guide cat?

Fields.DialogueText: And Stripey is the cleverest I've ever met.
When you're having an episode, sometimes you can't.
I don't think I'm in any danger. But it's difficult for me to tell.
The point is, Captain, we're stuck in a vicious cycle.
I am agitated. So Stripey gets protective. She sits in my lap and calms me down.
And she attacks anything that looks at you funny.
Mmm. So how do you want to handle this?
At this rate, I'll be desensitized.
We all will be. To the deck?
What we talked about the other day. I'm not sure how to fix it.
I really don't hate your cat.
If it was, we'd have fixed it by now.

Fields.MenuText: But I thought you said you trusted me.
... After all we've been through together?
Damn. Here I thought we had something.

Fields.DialogueText: Hold your fire, Captain. I'm not talking about you. Not as a person, not as a... friend.
It's more about the idea of a commanding officer. If I do not think a superior is making a good choice. I get...
I get very, very *thoughtful*. If you catch my meaning.
... Stripey is keeping me here, Captain. Keeping me... in the world, and not in my head.
Do I need to explain why I get uncomfortable about your relationship with her?
If you think I'm making a bad choice, especially if it's a choice that could part you from a friend...
Well. Like I said, I don't hate your cat. And I'm going to prove it.
Better than any alarm. Aren't you, girl? Aren't you?
And I've been on edge, lately. I don't need to spell out why.
You said "things cats like," and I couldn't find any other shapes. Unless you wanted to feed her rabbit.
Mmm... I was thinking beef. Or chicken.
Good luck finding a cow-shaped cookie cutter.
Can't be harder than finding beef and tin.
I'm not a miracle worker, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: You have the patience of a saint.

Fields.DialogueText: I try. You help. Best Captain I've ever had.
Well. I've got to get to the bridge. Thanks again.
Don't mention it. -- And seriously, good luck with that cat. It's a menace.
She's trying to keep our Belle safe. Just like the rest of us.

Fields.MenuText: You sure about that?

Fields.DialogueText: If I was a miracle worker, we wouldn't be low on ammo.

Fields.MenuText: Warspite's enough of a miracle for one ship.

Fields.DialogueText: You can say that again. These girls... Christ, they're good.
Let's hope these end your lovers' quarrel.
It's okay. I'm not gonna hurt you.
I can't believe it. It worked.
Ah! You snuck up on me.
I wanted to see what you were feeding my cat.
Beef-flavoured fish. Here-- see for yourself.
They're well-made, Captain. You did this yourself?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing but the best for you, 'Spite. And your cat.
I had help from the Quartermaster.
I did. We needed a peace offering.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, thank you. Stripey likes them, that's endorsement enough for me.
I'll have to thank her too, then.
I'm glad your negotiations went well.
I've become a feline diplomat, it seems.
If only we could fend off the Morganas with cat treats.
You can't fit misery in a cookie cutter.
Captain! I wanted to ask you about-- is that Stripey?
Well, I never. I thought you two would be fighting til Judgement Day.

Fields.MenuText: The cat has judged me, seems like.
I did too. But there's hope for everyone, it seems.
I guess she had a change of heart.

Fields.DialogueText: And you've not been found wanting!
I'm just glad I don't have to choose.
Between my sanity and my Captain.
It's Injustice again. Are you going to be--
I'm not made of glass, Captain.
Roger that. I'll follow your lead.
... It's your cat. She's running for something.
Captain. I have to go after her.

Fields.MenuText: You don't mean--
We need you to keep the mist off!
Don't just run after her! We need a plan!

Fields.DialogueText: There's no time! You want her to get shot down?
Yes. She's going to attack Injustice.
And I wouldn't want to, even if I could.

Fields.MenuText: Not for *your* sake, we won't.
Ha-hahahahahahaha-
Get that cat out of the line of fire!

Fields.DialogueText: What's so funny? Stripey's in danger.
I know, but- look at them! Just look-
Direct hit confirmed, Captain! She's going down!
We've got to get her out of there.
She's down! Fell off the deck.

Fields.MenuText: We can still save her.
We need you here. She needs you here.
Snap out of it! We don't have time for this!

Fields.DialogueText: ... You're... you're right. She's not dead.
Ganas to starboard. They're comin' in hot!
Stay with me, 'Spite. We'll get her. But you gotta stay with me.
Let's mop up the stragglers. And find Warspite!

Fields.MenuText: Your hands are shaking--
....Oh.... oh god.
... Here for you.

Fields.DialogueText: She's breathing. She's... she's gonna be...
I got you. I got you.
Medic! I need a medic, stat!
Yeah, you don't sound fine. Medic!
She's... fine... It's gonna... be fine.
Yeah. I got you. You're safe.
Good to see you up and about.
I'm fine, Captain. It was scrapes and bruises.
You really would have sent out the frogmen?

Fields.MenuText: Of course. Stripey's part of our crew.
You need her to stay sane. Why wouldn't I?
I don't give orders I don't intend to carry out.

Fields.DialogueText: You really are willing to go the extra mile for me.
That's what friends are for.  --Oh, that reminds me.
... Warms my heart to hear you say that, Captain.
Oh, speaking of warming the heart.
I try. -- That reminds me. Command made a sensible decision for once.
Our new orders are taking us... to the south Pacific.
Oh, thank God. A change of scenery will do us all good.
It's not a vacation by any stretch, but... it'll be away from here.
How hard did you have to push to get us moved that far?
Not all that hard. But being up here puts you on edge. And with everything that's been going on...
Mmm. I won't lie, it will be nice to get away for a little while. But...
With the way you've treated me, and with the way you've treated Stripey...
I may not trust my captain.... but I trust my Captain. Even if we had to spend the entire rest of the war up here...
With you by my side? We'd make it through.
There's really nowhere I'd rather be. Than by your side, I mean, not out here in Morgana-infested waters.
Thank you for making that clear.
We should spend more time together socially. Not just on the bridge or talking about crises.
I don't know what I have to talk about if we rule out crises, Captain.
We're clever people - and I'm told *she* may be the cleverest cat on the planet. I bet we could figure something out.
